abstracts.cdata!:
The Sana'a Emergency Power Project
            will consist of three inter-related components:
            rehabilitation/upgrading activities for the existing
            diesel-fuelled power plant at Dhahban site; installation of
            additional generating capacity at the existing site; and,
            expansion/upgrading of the Asser sub-station, including
            elements to avoid transmission congestion in the existing
            network. During construction and operation, mitigation
            measures will include: 1) On the effects of oil spillage, a
            new simple oil/water system for handling discharged oil
            polluted waste-waters, will replace the old spillway system.
            Spill trays at "hot spots" will be installed for
            handling oil polluted soil, and oily water during
            construction. 2) During operation, the stack height for the
            power plants will be increased to control air quality. 3)
            Internal and external noise abatement measures will be
            ensured, to include partial insulation in buildings, and,
            provide hearing protection devices. 4) Overall working
            conditions should be improved in cooperation with the
            Department of Public Health and Safety. Contingency plans
            will include fire and emergency procedures. 6) The
            construction company will be instructed to use
            archaeological "chance find" procedures, if
            encountered with such sites during construction. It is
            proposed to include consultancy assistance to secure the
            environmental mitigation measures.
